title: Claude 4 benchmarks show improvements, but context is still 200K
summary: Today, OpenAI rival Anthropic announced Claude 4 models, which are significantly better than Claude 3 in benchmarks, but we're left disappointed with the same 200,000 context window limit. [...]

title: Oops: DanaBot Malware Devs Infected Their Own PCs
summary: The U.S. government today unsealed criminal charges against 16 individuals accused of operating and selling DanaBot, a prolific strain of information-stealing malware that has been sold on Russian cybercrime forums since 2018. title: US indicts leader of Qakbot botnet linked to ransomware attacks
summary: The U.S. government has indicted Russian national Rustam Rafailevich Gallyamov, the leader of the Qakbot botnet malware operation that compromised over 700,000 computers and enabled ransomware attacks. [...]

title: Hackers use fake Ledger apps to steal Mac users’ seed phrases
summary: Cybercriminal campaigns are using fake Ledger apps to target macOS users and their digital assets by deploying malware that attempts to steal seed phrases that protect access to digital cryptocurrency wallets. [...]

title: Police arrests 270 dark web vendors, buyers in global crackdown
summary: Police arrested 270 suspects following an international law enforcement action codenamed 'Operation RapTor' that targeted dark web vendors and customers from ten countries. [...]

title: Chinese Hackers Exploit Trimble Cityworks Flaw to Infiltrate U.S. Government Networks
summary:
A Chinese-speaking threat actor tracked as UAT-6382 has been linked to the exploitation of a now-patched remote-code-execution vulnerability in Trimble Cityworks to deliver Cobalt Strike and VShell.

title: Ivanti EPMM flaw exploited by Chinese hackers to breach govt agencies
summary: Chinese hackers have been exploiting a remote code execution flaw in Ivanti Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) to breach high-profile organizations worldwide. [...]

title: Chinese hackers breach US local governments using Cityworks zero-day
summary: Chinese-speaking hackers have exploited a now-patched Trimble Cityworks zero-day to breach multiple local governing bodies across the United States. [...]
